moves.1. e4 d6 2. d4 Nf6 3. Nc3 e5 4. dxe5 dxe: This move does not accomplish much
moves.13. Nxb6: Nxb6? is the start of White's problems
moves.13... Nxb6: Now White must exchange 2 pcs for rook and pawn, which favors Black
moves.17. f3 Bd7 18. a4 a6: Black wants to be able to support the advanced Knight and slow the pawn advance
moves.21. Rc1 Rd8 22. a5 b5 23. Rc3 Bc4: Very strong, cramps White's mobility and prepares for a future c5.
moves.27. Red1: Tries to exchange off the strong rook, but black can control the d-file
moves.27... Rxd1+ 28. Rxd1 Ke7 29. Kf2 c5: Creates a weakness on b4 or c3
moves.32. Kh4: White hopes to make inroads but can be blocked
moves.32... g6 33. Kg4 Nc6 34. Rb1: the rook is reduced to guarding the pawn and now d4  is available after the pawn exchange
moves.34... Nd4 35. h4: White wants to probe for weaknesses, but does not see that the king is in trouble
moves.35... Kf6 36. Rb2 Ne2: Threatening checkmate, with the intent to drive back White's king
moves.37. Rd2: Rd2?? White misses the threat. If instead 37h5, g5 38 Kh3 white can hold on
